text:
When my apache http server rotates its logs, after the reception of a SIGHUP it
sometimes crashes after this error:

[alert] mod_unique_id: unable to gethostbyname("foo")

(foo is the name of my server, his FQDN is foo.bar.com). It seems to be a dns
lookup problem but I don't think that there is a problem with my dns servers...

It happened 2 times.

Other hypothesis, another computer on my network may have the same IP at this
time but I can't verify it...

If you need more precisions, just ask!
creator: damien@gouju.net

text:
this is a configuration error.

Your machines DNS and hostname are not setup correctly.

If you don't need mod_unique_id (and most people don't), please disable it.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
